titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: This morning's paper raises the death–rate at the Hartlepools to 86. In the course of the day it was announced that fresh attacks were anticipated, and that the population had been ordered to evacuate the town.
The "Times" announces that Egypt has been declared a British Protectorate

. It would appear that the senseless Khedive, having thrown in his lot with Germany & Turkey, has been promptly 'eliminated'. I attended Evensong in the cathedral, & wrote a number of letters. Also I finished reading a curiously interesting book, Disraeli's "Lord George Bentinck". The new volume of Disraeli's 'Life' induced a curiosity which, as the volume was on my shelves, I was able to satisfy. The chapter on the Jews is priceless.
